qas.question: What group did Nigeria support against white governments in Southern Africa?
What group was Nigeria a founding member of?
What is the Organisation for African Unity now known as?
Nigeria is a 'standard-bearer' in what international group?

answers.text: the Economic Community of West African States

context: Nigeria's foreign policy was tested in the 1970s after the country emerged united from its own civil war. It supported movements against white minority governments in the Southern Africa sub-region. Nigeria backed the <a0_0>African National Congress<a0_0/> (ANC) by taking a committed tough line with regard to the South African government and their military actions in southern Africa. Nigeria was also a founding member of the <a1_0>Organisation for African Unity<a1_0/> (now <a2_0>the African Union<a2_0/>), and has tremendous influence in West Africa and Africa on the whole. Nigeria has additionally founded regional cooperative efforts in West Africa, functioning as standard-bearer for <a3_0>the Economic Community of West African States<a3_0/> (ECOWAS) and ECOMOG, economic and military organisations, respectively.
